comments:
I am not sure this is the correct component for this.  Please reassign if it is incorrect.

I get the following error when trying to run a Hit Rate report:

IWAT4022E:  An error happened during report generation.

Error:  Validation Error:
DOM:s4s-att-invalid-value: Invalid attribute value for 'xml:lang' in element with respect to pattern '([a-zA-Z]{1.8}-X-[a-zA-Z0-9]{1,8}*' for type 'language'

This also occurs when generating Response Time report.

After run a URLTest, right-click on the testsuite -> Report->Hit Rate
Sheldon could you please have a look at this issue.
I can't reproduce the problem.  Could you send me your workspace that contains the test models.

I would like to reopen this defect since I can easily reproduce it with the latest build 200602240100.  

I will attach the workspace from today.  I right-click on the testsuite ->Report->HTTP Page Hit Rate (check the box to automatically open the report).  Then click Next.  Select the place for the report (testproj for project, and hr1 for the name of report), click Finish.  Select any of the test logs and click Finish.  The error described is displayed.

I am using the latest build and Eclipse 3.2M5 .

I'm reopening the bug based on the last comment.  

I'm targetting this bug for i2 since I can not reproduce the bug with the workspace provided.  I tried jdk 1.4.2 and jdk 1.5.  I used driver tptp.runtime-TPTP-4.2.0-200602230100.  

I looked at the log file and found the following exception:

java.io.IOException: Validation Error:
DOM:s4s-att-invalid-value: Invalid attribute value for 'xml:lang' in element 'schema'. Recorded reason: cvc-pattern-valid: Value 'latin1' is not facet-valid with respect to pattern '([a-zA-Z]{1,8})(-[a-zA-Z0-9]{1,8})*' for type 'language'.

	at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.report.core.provisional.SerializerImpl.read(SerializerImpl.java:137)

It looks like the chart model contains an unregonized character.  I am wondering if the reports where generated for a different language other than english on your machine.  

Can you trying generating a "XML Test Report" instead.  Make sure you specify a time interval.  Try a start time of '02/24/2003 05:13:03 PM' and an end time of '02/24/2006 05:13:03 PM'

Could you post the xml file that is produced.
I can generate this report successfully using JRE 1.4.2 .  However, if I run the same report with JRE 1.5, I get the error described.

I used the following jre and it works:

java version "1.5.0_06"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.5.0_06-b05)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.5.0_06-b05, mixed mode, sharing)


Could you post the jre information that you're using.  Are you using an IBM jre or SUN?

I issue the java -version command from the DOS prompt, here is what i get:

D:\4.2i1FinalMarch02\eclipse>java -version

java version "1.5.0"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build pwi32dev-20051104)
IBM J9 VM (build 2.3, J2RE 1.5.0 IBM J9 2.3 Windows XP x86-32 j9vmwi3223-20051103 (JIT enabled)
J9VM - 20051027_03723_lHdSMR
JIT  - 20051027_1437_r8
GC   - 20051020_AA)
JCL  - 20051102

I was able to reproduce the problem with IBM jdk 1.5.  The problem is that the chart.xsd file contains an invalid attribute.  I guess the xml validator shipped in IBM jdk 1.5 is different than the SUN jdk 1.5.  I will check in this fix when 4.2i1 is done.
Changed xml:lang attribute to a valid value from latin1 to en in chart.xsd.

Closing by default since not closed by the originator in the 7+ months since being resolved.  

Please reopen if the issue is still present in the latest TPTP release or the resolution is not correct.

traces.message: Validation Error: DOM:s4s-att-invalid-value: Invalid attribute value for 'xml:lang' in element 'schema'. Recorded reason: cvc-pattern-valid: Value 'latin1' is not facet-valid with respect to pattern '([a-zA-Z]{1,8})(-[a-zA-Z0-9]{1,8})*' for type 'language'.
